textRegions.text: Recently Moved to Raleigh (Apex) from DC
Types: Relevant Data in a Group
Each Type & Index can have different data elements
You define ID - POST or PUT
Using PUT with no ID will throw error

POST {"ok":true,"_index":"rdu","_type":"brewery","_id":"Iw9kfa3vSx2FyFen-uK26Q","_version":1}POST OR PUT{"ok":true,"_index":"rdu","_type":"brewery","_id":"1","_version":1}PUTNo handler found for uri [/rdu/brewery/] and method [PUT]
Search, Add Mappings, Status, refresh & Optimization on Index.
Displays Comprehensive Status Information on an indices.
Refresh: refresh data for near real-time search.
Optimize: Optimizes Lucene segments for faster searching.
Defines how the document is mapped to search
You don’t have to define this.  It’s dynamic. But you can....
You can define them at the Index and Type level
string, integer/long, float/double, boolean, and null
Performed through a web request or curl request.
Allows for Filters, Facets, Boosting, More Like this, Fuzzy, etc.
Facets are Logical Grouping that allow easier search navigation.
Terms, Range, Histogram, Date Histogram, Statistical, & Geo
Routing - Tell were to look at node/shard, etc.
A river is a pluggable service running within elasticsearch cluster pulling data (or being pushed with data) that is then indexed into the cluster.
Implementation of Tika.  Allows for Document Indexing (PDF, DOC, etc.)
Allows you to do everything in objects that you pass around.
Preloaded Index (rdu) with two types (brewery, beer).
LSE and DFW indexes also exist.
Uses BreweryDB Data through the API

gets data for brewery 1
result on next pg
notes.slide-15: use the same ID.  use PUT
notes.slide-26: If you define a mapping then insert data and its not in the mapping it will create those fields dynamically.  If you try to add data to a field that is index and its not in the right format it will fail
